snippet: The administration of Mayor Bill de Blasio, whose campaign relied heavily on contributions from the yellow cab industry, signaled that it would slow the growth of a rival taxi fleet.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration signals that it will slow growth of green cabs intended to expand street-hail service outside Manhattan; new fleet has been vigorously opposed by powerful yellow-taxi industry, which donated heavily to de Blasio's mayoral campaign.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

lead_paragraph: The administration of Mayor Bill de Blasio, whose campaign relied heavily on contributions from the yellow cab industry, signaled that it would slow the growth of a rival taxi fleet.

headline.main: New York City Moves to Slow Growth of Popular Green-Cab Fleet
headline.print_headline: City Moves to Slow Growth of Popular Green-Cab Fleet
